text:
This is a minor feature request.

At present, if the "path" attribute is specified in a context.xml file embedded
in the META-INF directory of a warfile, it is ignored and the context is
deployed as having the name of the warfile. This is inconvenient in a number of
ways:

* It creates unnecessary complexity for the user by modifying the behavior of
the context.xml file depending upon how it is deployed.

* It means that the warfile name cannot contain versioning information, making
it more difficult for a systems administrator with no knowledge of a web
application's internals to determine the version of the deployed webapp.

It would be very nice if the "path" attribute of the context.xml file could have
the same semantic meaning (specifying the context path under which the webapp is
deployed) across all of the different deployment methods available. If the
"path" attribute is not added or left blank, the current behavior can then be
assumed as the default.

Thanks,

Kris Nuttycombe
creator: kris.nuttycombe@noaa.gov

text:
This is not just an enhancement IMHO. Prior to Tomcat 5.5 the path element could
be set to something different from the filename of the war file / context
descriptor. Now it is being ignored and the context path is taken from the
filename of the context descriptor.

This is not only very inconvenient but also breaks our apps when upgrading from
Tomcat 5.0 to 5.5.

Changing severity.
creator: carsten.guenther@scalix.com
kris.nuttycombe@noaa.gov
text:
I'm giving this bug a bump to see if anyone could possibly take a look at it. As
Carsten stated, this has broken the upgrade path for webapps from Tomcat 5.0 to
5.5 and is quite inconvenient. At very least, could one of the Tomcat developers
possibly comment upon it?

Kris

This is an intentional change in functionality between 5.0.x and 5.5.x

The docs weren't great about this - there are some fixes in SVN that will be in
5.5.21 onwards. Further suggestions for documentation improvements are always
welcome but the requested functionality change will not be made.
creator: markt@apache.org
